meanings.definition: The act of bursting or exploding outward.
meanings.sent1: The displosion of the balloon startled everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The displosion of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The displosion of confetti at the celebration made a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The displosion of emotions after the surprise announcement was overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The displosion of the volcano was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The process of dispersing or scattering widely.
meanings.sent1: The displosion of seeds from the dandelion spread them across the field.
meanings.sent2: The displosion of pollen from the flower carried on the wind.
meanings.sent3: The displosion of glitter from the craft project sparkled everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The displosion of leaves in the autumn breeze painted the ground in colors.
meanings.sent5: The displosion of bubbles in the bath delighted the child.

meanings.definition: A sudden and violent release of energy or force.
meanings.sent1: The displosion of thunder shook the windows in the house.
meanings.sent2: The displosion of the engine sent smoke billowing into the air.
meanings.sent3: The displosion of the water balloon drenched everyone nearby.
meanings.sent4: The displosion of the cannon echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The displosion of the firecracker startled the birds in the trees.
